sprint_goal: Establish core infrastructure (AWS/Terraform), CI/CD pipeline, RBAC, and foundational master data models for Vehicle, Driver, Customer, Route, and Material.
epic_coverage: Core System & Architecture Setup,Master Data Management
key_deliverables: Provisioned AWS environment; Functional CI pipeline; Core Odoo addon with all Master Data models and basic views.
demo_objectives: Show the CI pipeline blocking a bad PR. Demonstrate creating a Vehicle, Driver, and Customer record in the Odoo UI.
success_criteria: All infrastructure is provisioned. CI is functional. Admin can perform CRUD on all master data models.
risk_factors: Complexity of EKS and VPC networking configuration; Delays in AWS account setup.
mitigation_strategies: Thorough design review of VPC architecture; Early setup of AWS credentials.
burndown_target: Linear burndown, aiming for 100 estimated hours completed by end of week 1.

sprint_goal: Implement the end-to-end operational trip lifecycle: assignment, start trip, log events, submit expenses, and upload Proof of Delivery. Complete CD pipeline and observability setup.
key_deliverables: Functional trip assignment with validation; Driver Portal with trip start, event logging, and POD upload capabilities; Expense submission and approval workflow.
demo_objectives: As a Dispatch Manager, assign a trip. As a Driver, start the trip, log an 'Accident' event, and upload a signature POD. As a Manager, approve a submitted expense.
success_criteria: The full operational trip lifecycle can be demonstrated from 'Planned' to 'Delivered'.
risk_factors: Integration of JS signature pad library with OWL; Mobile browser compatibility for file uploads.
mitigation_strategies: Early PoC for signature library (TASK-043); E2E testing on physical mobile devices.
integration_windows: Driver Portal frontend components integrate with backend trip methods throughout the sprint.
burndown_target: Linear burndown with 80 estimated hours completed by end of week 1.

sprint_goal: Deliver core financial workflow (GST e-invoicing) and the real-time GPS tracking map. Implement FastAPI microservice for GPS ingestion.
key_deliverables: Functional e-invoicing with GSP sandbox integration, including async fallback. Real-time map view showing in-transit vehicles. Deployed GPS ingestion microservice.
demo_objectives: As a Finance Officer, generate a compliant e-invoice for a completed trip. As a Dispatch Manager, view a moving vehicle on the live map.
success_criteria: E-invoice can be successfully generated against the GSP sandbox. Live map updates vehicle locations within the 60s latency NFR.
risk_factors: GSP API unreliability or poor documentation; Performance of the real-time data pipeline under load.
mitigation_strategies: Dedicated analysis task for GSP API; Resilient async fallback pattern; Performance testing for GPS pipeline.
external_dependencies: GSP API Sandbox, GPS Provider API Sandbox
integration_windows: Integration between FastAPI microservice, RabbitMQ, and Odoo consumer. Integration with GSP sandbox.
burndown_target: Linear burndown with 65 estimated hours completed by end of week 1.
